description:
SpaceX was founded under the belief that a future where humanity is out exploring the stars is fundamentally more exciting than one where we are not. Today SpaceX is actively developing the technologies to make this possible, with the ultimate goal of enabling human life on Mars.

OPERATIONS ANALYST (INFRASTRUCTURE)

As a member of the infrastructure engineering team, you will apply your knowledge, experience and creativity to help design, build, and activate some of the world’s most technically advanced manufacturing facilities. The Construction and Infrastructure Engineering team builds the machine that makes the machine, in this case the factory that builds the world’s most advanced rocket, engine and components. Process flow, machine moves, project planning and detailed department level metrics and dashboards all fall under the scope of this role. If you like strategic planning, juggling many different priorities, improving processes, and spending your time in a dynamic work environment, then this team may be for you! This role will deport directly to the department head and serve as the resource org-wide.

Responsibilities

  • Develop internal visual standards for internal work boards, JIRA queuing, PowerBI dashboards, and department workflow
  • Support department continuous improvement projects such as new process rollouts/standardization
  • Integrate with all levels of the business to understand current workflows and identify systematic gaps
  • Define and develop department-level metrics & associated dashboards that quantify the health of our operations and influence change
  • Conduct in-depth analyses through SQL queries and other data analysis methods to dive into problems and identify trends for decision making, following the rules of clear visual indicators and linear flow
  • Create reports, tools, and standardized metrics for operational measurements and improvements
  • Develop automation that mitigates business risk or creates efficiencies within the SpaceX factory
  • Conduct department wide operations audits that streamline the repair and maintenance and construction engineering teams
  • Maintenance program enhancement – increase attention on poor-health hardware and descope unnecessary work
  • Implement construction management or maintenance tools (software or hardware) to reduce wasted effort by engineers and techs
  • Site services analysis to ensure smart spending on contracts such as custodial, utilities, waste, etc. and roadmap to improve
  • Build communication tools and reports targeted at factory workcell directors to improve communication and facilitate customer service
  • Standardize material library and procurement process to reduce project lead times
  • Drive alignment with maintenance and construction teams at other SpaceX sites across the country to reduce duplicated work

Basic Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in engineering, business, supply chain, management information systems, computer science, or economics
  • 2+ years of experience in an operations, data analytics, consulting, production coordination, scheduling, or planning role

Preferred Skills And Experience

  • 4+ years of professional experience
  • Process focused experience including project management, capacity modeling, process mapping, and layouts
  • Experience with inventory, production, and capacity planning (including MRP/ERP systems)
  • Experience in using Excel, VBA, SQL, or Python/R for analysis or modeling dynamic systems
  • Experience with creating and managing dashboards using data visualization tools using Power BI
  • Experience with lean, six sigma, and related production principles
  • Ability to work well across teams and skill sets to find the simplest and best solution
  • Experience as a contributor to multi-disciplinary and cross-functional teams

Additional Requirements

  • Must be comfortable stooping, bending, and standing
  • Position may require occasional travel, extended hours, or weekend work

Pay Range

COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:

Operations Analyst/Level I: $75,000.00 - $95,000.00/per year

Operations Analyst/Level II: $90,000.00 - $115,000.00/per year

Your actual level and base salary will be determined on a case-by-case basis and may vary based on the following considerations: job-related knowledge and skills, education, and experience.

Base salary is just one part of your total rewards package at SpaceX. You may also be eligible for long-term incentives, in the form of company stock, stock options, or long-term cash awards, as well as potential discretionary bonuses and the ability to purchase additional stock at a discount through an Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You will also receive access to comprehensive medical, vision, and dental coverage, access to a 401(k) retirement plan, short and long-term disability insurance, life insurance, paid parental leave, and various other discounts and perks. You may also accrue 3 weeks of paid vacation and will be eligible for 10 or more paid holidays per year. Exempt employees are eligible for 5 days of sick leave per year.

Itar Requirements

  • To conform to U.S. Government export regulations, applicant must be a (i) U.S. citizen or national, (ii) U.S. lawful, permanent resident (aka green card holder), (iii) Refugee under 8 U.S.C.
  • 1157, or (iv) Asylee under 8 U.S.C.
  • 1158, or be eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about the ITAR here.

SpaceX is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with SpaceX is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.

Applicants wishing to view a copy of SpaceX’s Affirmative Action Plan for veterans and individuals with disabilities, or applicants requiring reasonable accommodation to the application/interview process should notify the Human Resources Department at (310) 363-6000.
